pageContext.claim: “Remember [Obamacare]? It was going to cost $5 million. It cost 15 -- no, $5 billion, right? Five billion. It still didn't work.”
pageContext.analysis: The Obamacare website was expensive, but it didn't cost five billion dollars, according to both the Obama administration and an independent analysis from Bloomberg Government. PolitiFact reported in July 2015 "We asked the Bloomberg Government study's author, Peter Gosselin, whether he thought the number could have more than doubled to $5 billion since the study was released 10 months ago. He was skeptical, saying that even if you add on a five-year follow-up contract with the firm Accenture, it should 'only get you about halfway to $5 billion.'"
